reviewText: The art was beautiful. the story was compelling, The moral was great: sometime doing what you gotta do will save your world.
One of my favorite stories from childhood. I purchased the DVD to give to my grandson as a Christmas present. Well worth it.

I bought the book expecting to see the illustrations from the video in the book.  They are not in the book and my 7 year old great granddaughter was fascinated with the video and so was I.  Any child interested in drawing would be able to pause the video and copy the drawings.
Beautiful animations,great interpretation of wonderfull story by such a great artist!
Beautifully illustrated Japanese folk-tale filled with suspense and a terrific surprise ending!
Very enjoyable for basically the illustrated version of books on tape.
Really liked it!  It took a while to develop but once it ended, you could see the wonderful intricacies of the plot.
I love the story and narration
Beautifully illustrated, well narrated, and compelling tale.

Truly gorgeous illustrations (many!) and William Hurt tells the story well. My only issue was that it was slow. This could have been told in half the time with better pacing. A pity - because the story actually clips along in traditional retellings and is quite dramatic. I'd still recommend a viewing but be prepared for a little squirming if showing it to kids - even the transitions between scenes are slow.
A gem of a story. Thoughtfully produced. Fantastic illustrations. Not your typical animation or fairytale.
a favorite folktale for all
It was very lovely story and drawing. Our kids loved this.
A fantastic story, wonderfully narrated and beautifully illustrated.
What a strange tale! I loved the artwork.
Unexpected story line. A little grim for small children.
Beautiful story and marvelous illustrations and soundtrack.

Although William Hurts voice can be sort of monotonous and a bit slow for kids, I really enjoyed this telling, slightly different from the audio version, but I have shown this to my 2nd grade class and it was just the right amount of creepy for them without being scary.

This is like having William Hurt read a story to you and show you the pictures than and animated film.
The illustrations are lovely and the story gentle.
Not unlike the western counterparts at all; Grimms, Anderson's, And beautifully drawn. I will buy the DVD and add it to my collection.
Thought this would be a good story for kids but ended up being too scary for the kids and had to turn it off.
I enjoyed this very much and would watch again, although the streaming was very intermittent; not sure it that was the fault of my provider or Amazon.
I would recommend this story for ages (at the very youngest) 6 and up due to dramatic music and some frightening bits. Wonderful illustrations and powerful story.
Must have to accompany the book.

Charming tale of learning responsibility and strength of character. The littlest one proves to be wise in a folktale from Japan.
Nice to explore a tradition beyond warrior tales. Beautiful art, narration by William hurt is effective. Music fits the setting well.
Wonderful bedtime story.  We use it every night. Mr. Hurt has a great voice for animation.
Cute movie.
A great cartoon of a lovely book with excellent reading. I would like to share this brief film/book with my grandchildren next time I see them. They need exposure to the stories of other cultures.
This was my favorite story as a kid. Words cannot express how excited I am that this movie is on amazon instant!!!
I loved this story. William Hurt is a great narrator,  the annimation incredible.
Different kind of story telling, was great for me. On the other hand, I had a tough time keeping my daughters watching at the beginning but they got hoked after a while.
I had seen this when I was a kid, and I still enjoy it. I like the storytelling and the little to no animation.
The animator, art was fantastic!
